business.headline: New tax rules coming soon. How the Income Tax Bill 2025 could impact youThe new law aims to make income tax rules easier to understand, reduce legal disputes, and help people comply with tax rules more easily.

Sebi may relax IPO float norms for big firms to just 2.5% equity: ReportAt present, Sebi rules say that any company with a post-issue capital of more than Rs 1 lakh crore must offer 5% equity and raise at least Rs 5,000 crore.

ED investigates Anil Ambani in loan fraud case, summoned on August 5The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Anil Ambani for questioning on August 5 in the national capital. This is in connection with an investigation into an alleged loan fraud of Rs 12,500 crore. The development follows multiple searches the ED carried out at 35 locations in Mumbai, targeting business entities linked to the Anil Ambani group under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The probe agency's action is also based on findings from a separate investigation by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). A key point in the investigation is an alleged diversion of funds, with the transcript stating, "The development actually came after the SEBI shared with the enforcement directorate the findings of a separate probe that launched into the alleged diversion of 10,000 crore by the Reliant infrastructure."
Why has ED summoned Anil Ambani on August 5Anil Ambani, chairman and managing director of Reliance Group, has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning on August 5.

Indian state refiners halt Russian oil imports as US threatens penalty: ReportState-run refiners in India have halted Russian oil purchases in the past week due to shrinking discounts and mounting pressure from former US President Donald Trump's threats of tariffs and sanctions.

Women's workforce participation is very low; Kalpana Viswanath, CEO SafetipinIn a powerful discussion on women's rights and safety, a call was made for systemic change over waiting for patriarchal mindsets to shift. 'We just need the right to walk safely without looking over our shoulders,' one speaker emphasised, highlighting that safety is a right, not a form of protection. The conversation revealed that women hold less than 2% of jobs in the burgeoning gig economy, a stark contrast to their participation in the traditional economy. The panel also explored how urban infrastructure and product design often have a male-as-norm bias, from the height of bus handrails to the lack of pockets in women's clothing. The dialogue touched upon the 'pink tax' in transportation, where trip-chaining results in higher travel costs for women. The need for an enabling environment, including better public transport and services, was stressed as crucial for women's economic and social participation.

Fenesta CMO Susmita Nag discusses gender bias in hiring within professional workspacesA discussion highlights the stark reality for women in India's corporate sector, where they make up only 18% of the workforce in top NSE-listed companies. A woman leader recounted her early career in the late 90s, where she was told the company 'don't hire girls' and faced a lack of basic facilities like restrooms and proper safety gear in a factory setting. Another speaker addressed the issue of tokenism on corporate boards, suggesting that having three or more women in a group forms a cohort, whereas one is mere tokenism. The conversation delved into unconscious biases in hiring, noting that women's resumes are scrutinised for marital status more often than men's. The speakers emphasised that while policies like flexi-working exist, they can lead to subtle penalties and that a fundamental mindset shift, beyond just policy changes, is crucial for true gender equity in the workplace.

ITR refund delayed? Check your status in these 2 easy waysUsually, if your return is e-verified, the refund is credited within four to five weeks. But if you're still waiting, you can easily check your refund status online.

Lead from the front: Pallavi Shroff on breaking barriers, building legaciesSpeaking at the India Today Woman Summit 2025, Pallavi S Shroff, Managing Partner, Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas said that when she began her practice in 1981, there were barely four or five women arguing cases in court.

India set to be 3rd largest economy: Minister after Trump's 'dead economy' jabThe minister's remarks come amid rising concerns over the broader implications of the US move, including potential delays to the ongoing trade deal talks and uncertainty in sectors heavily reliant on US markets.

Women had to work twice as hard: Pallavi Shroff reflects on male-dominated professionPallavi Shroff, Managing Partner at Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas & Co., spoke on her four-decade journey in a male-dominated legal profession. Shroff stated that when she began, women had to 'work twice as hard to prove that we are half as good as our male colleagues'. She recounted starting her practice in 1981, facing clients who refused to meet a woman lawyer and judges who were dismissive. A significant turning point came in 1991 when a client, for a matter in the Allahabad High Court, chartered a flight for her as she was unable to travel by train after a surgery. Shroff also discussed the challenges for women in the Indian judiciary, the existence of unconscious bias, the handling of an $11 billion deal by an all-women team, and her view that leadership means leading from the front with humility and compassion.

India will be tough to beat in Women's ODI World Cup: Alyssa HealyAlyssa Healy said that India will be tough to beat in the Women's ODI World Cup later this year, given how Harmanpreet Kaur's team has played in home conditions in the last few months.

3 successive Test series defeats would be a problem for Gambhir: Michael AthertonFormer England captain Michael Atherton has said that losing the ongoing series against England would mount problems for India head coach Gautam Gambhir, as the team has already lost the last two series under his tenure.

Don't judge Anshul Kamboj based on one Test match: Sourav GangulyENG vs IND: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly said Anshul Kamboj should not be judged based on just one Test and deserves a longer run of at least five matches.

Breaking barriers: Bihar's new sporting heroes show the way forwardSpeaking at India Today's Woman Summit 2025, javelin thrower Nishi Kumari, archer Anshika Kumari, and rugby player Alpana Kumari shared their journeys toward sporting glory. The three athletes spoke about the unwavering support of their parents and highlighted their battles against the odds.

Oval Test: Gautam Gambhir faces heat for Arshdeep, Kuldeep omissionGautam Gambhir was slammed on social media for his selection calls in the final Test against England at the Oval where the likes of Kuldeep Yadav and Arshdeep Singh were ignored.

No Bumrah, Karun Nair gets 2nd chance as India make 4 changes for Oval TestJasprit Bumrah has been rested for the Oval Test while Karun Nair has got a second chance in England as India make four changes for the match. There was no debut for Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav had to sit out of the game yet again.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
